title: Business Intelligence Associate
description:
We’re looking for a Business Intelligence Associate who lives and breathes data to join our BizOps team in NYC. If you are motivated by accuracy and business impact with rock star data skills and want to bring value to a socially-conscious, hyper-growth insurance startup, this one’s for you!

Data is at the core of everything that Lemonade does, and we act as the guardians of its integrity, and how it can be best used to make decisions throughout the business. The BizOps team partners with various groups at Lemonade to help the company make business decisions informed by data. We maintain our BI tool, Looker, and work closely with data engineering, product, and others to ensure our data and reporting is reliable, accurate, and supports key decision-making processes.

In this role, you’ll ensure a seamless data experience for core teams throughout the company. We’ll look to you to create analytics and support goal-setting across Lemonade. You’ll create reports and dashboards to monitor KPIs to ensure teams are making intelligent and informed decisions. It will be your responsibility to ensure quality assurance by being proactive in identifying discrepancies and irregularities within dashboards, visuals, and underlying LookML. Lastly, you’ll act as the bridge between technical and non-technical teams across our company, including various global offices, to drive success in data projects.

Requirements
2-4 years of BI experience
Proven SQL mastery (R and Python are plus)
Experience working with different databases and building out data infrastructure and reporting (experience using Looker a plus)
Start-up experience and database knowledge (Snowflake a plus) at a company level
Bachelor's degree in CS, Mathematics, Economics, or similar
Willingness to work with individuals in different time zones and cultures

title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
description:
DESCRIPTION

At quip, we design and deliver delightful and effective ways to keep your mouth healthy, from the daily care products that help you at home every day, to the professional care services you require at least twice a year.

Over the past five years, we have grown a large digital platform and community of millions of active consumer-members and tens of thousands of dental professional members through our direct to consumer channels. At the end of 2018 we launched nationwide in Target which has helped to further accelerate our growth and brand awareness across the United States. In 2020 we are looking to continue to expand into more households and release more products and services to make oral care from your daily routine to the dental chair more simple, accessible, and enjoyable to everyone.

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to work cross functionally with customer and operational reporting, insights and analytics.

As a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead, you will help to examine, position, and visualize our entire data stack to drive optimal business performance.  This is a critical role responsible for driving analytics & self-service reporting across the company. You will focus on conceptualizing and systematizing how we uncover data-driven insights that grow our business and improve our members’ experience, and you will manage a team to execute that vision.  This role will directly influence strategic questions and core business outcomes before they become urgent needs.

The ideal candidate possesses the following traits:

You know how to zoom between the nitty-gritty and the big picture: you love the details, but you can also take a step back and see what it all means in the big picture of the business.
You enjoy building a team of high-performing analysts: you know the skills and experience needed to assemble a high-performing analytics team, and enjoy managing them those individuals to achieve their full potential.
You like building tools & supporting infrastructure: the best analysis is great, but building self-service tools that replicate that analysis in a way others can use is even better. You have a knack for conceptualizing tools, processes, and systems with a track record to show for it.
You take pride in your technical analytical skills: you’re the one your friends can count on to ask if something is statistically significant.
You are an excellent verbal and written communicator: in a team of our size that’s growing as fast as it is, making sure that everyone has the information they need to make good decisions is paramount. You’re someone who can translate what you’re seeing in the data into actionable insights for all of our teams, whether you’re presenting in a meeting or writing an email.
You will not get frustrated constantly explaining basic data concepts to the rest of the team: we sell toothbrushes, come on.
You are a data evangelist: enough said

Duties & Responsibilities:

Lead and project manage analytical initiatives (e.g. new product pricing, KPI benchmarking) that affect all the business units
Lead and manage a growing team of analysts
Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, that enable self-service reporting of these key metrics
Partner with data engineer lead to identify and monitor KPIs
Lead cross-functional projects using advanced data analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities
Own and advocate for the full data ecosystem at quip (data pipelines, data models, data warehouse, business intelligence platform)
Automate and streamline existing analytics processes to maximize efficiency.
Help ensure that data is accurate and consistent throughout the organization.
Enable the analytics team to train the entire company on how to leverage our data tools and assess whether their conclusions are valid.
Work with engineering teams in tracking events that are critical to measuring company performance.
Apply statistics and modeling to business data

Requirements:

Expert in full stack analytics, with 6+ years of experience in data pipelines (Stitch/Fivetran), data modeling (dbt/LookML/etc.), data warehouses (Redshift/Snowflake/BigQuery), and business intelligence platforms (Looker/Domo/Tableau). Strong Excel skills.
8+ prior years of experience, including 4+ years of managing a team of analysts
Experience managing cross-functional projects and teams
Good communication skills that enable you to distill complex systems, processes, or analyses into understandable terms
Ability to balance long-term strategic planning with tactical analytical & reporting requests
Customer-centric mindset and the ability to understand quip’s target consumer
Strong project management, attention to detail, and a no-task-too-small mentality
Desire to leverage past experience to make a direct business impact and are motivated by a flexible environment

BENEFITS

You'll be working in a high energy, fast-paced environment helping us make oral care simple and effective!
An office located in the heart of DUMBO with breathtaking views of Manhattan Bridge
Fully covered health insurance (with an option to opt into a premium internal dental program)
Commuter benefits for parking & transit
Offer competitive paid parental leave policy for qualifying employees
Flexible work from home options
Open vacation policy
Dog-friendly office space
401k Contribution
Extended Education Assistance
Employee Referral Program
Competitive compensation package with stock options at a high-growth startup
Fully stocked kitchen with snacks (make sure to use your quip after snacking!)
Generous employee discount on all quip products
The opportunity to help us make oral care more simple, effective and accessible!

About quip

Most of us aren’t brushing our teeth correctly, either because we don’t know how to do it right, or because we just don’t feel like it. At quip, we design delightful products and experiences to help you care for your mouth better. Our initial product is a beautifully simple electric toothbrush and toothpaste that was featured by Time Magazine as one of the 25 Best Inventions of 2016. With refill brush heads and toothpaste arriving on a 3-monthly schedule. We pride ourselves on great design and our brand values of simplicity, honesty and accessibility, which are applied throughout our community. We are excited to apply these principles to the acceleration of our digital patient-professional advice and services platform.

quip is committed to promoting equality, inclusion, and diversity beyond your brushing routine. We believe our company is better equipped to care for every mouth when we listen to fresh perspectives from every voice, and in doing so, we build an equal-opportunity team of the brightest minds (and mouths)—regardless of race, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, identity, or any other trait that makes you you. By celebrating and supporting our differences, we will thrive in our mission to improve oral health for all.

title: Data Analyst, Business Intelligence & Analytics
description:
As the Data Analyst, Business Intelligence & Analytics, you will help Business, Product, Engineering, and Marketing stakeholders make insightful decisions by identifying relevant data, making it available through empowering reporting, and providing analysis that the stakeholders can use to make their decisions. You will help The Muse “level up” its data usage across the company by working on projects to ensure data quality and data governance. You care about identifying the right data points to answer the right questions with data. You are excited to be part of a team that will be operationalizing work to create a scalable team for the future of the organization.

How you'll make an impact

You’ll work with Product owners to understand product goals, define success metrics, identify tracking needed to answer questions, and build insightful reporting.
You’ll run queries to support ad hoc business questions and create Looker dashboards to enable self-service of other teams.
You’ll be responsible for identifying and helping to resolve data bug issues by providing analysis to communicate the issue and collaborating with Product and Engineering teams to identify and prioritize the fix. You’ll own bugs from the initial identification to the final resolution.
You’ll support company-wide efforts to improve data quality, accessibility, and governance. You’ll help build out systems to make data more open, empowering end users to do their own analysis. You’ll create trainings to teach Musers how to use data for their roles. You’ll work on a framework to create consistent event tracking.
You’ll help evaluate analytics tools and services to best meet the needs of the organization. You’ll help support and maintain these products, implementing changes to improve their functionality.

Why we'll love you

You have 3-5 years of relevant experience in data analysis and are well versed in SQL, Looker, and Excel.
You’re excited to not only provide answers but also to help people learn how to do their own analysis.
You are a “data detective” and will investigate issues until you’ve identified the root cause, ensuring good quality data.
You’re endlessly curious and never willing to ignore an outlier data point.
You want to be part of a team that is creating a BI and Analytics team for the next phase of The Muse that is implementing new services and processes meet stakeholder needs.
You want to provide input to strategic decisions and you bring the data to back your points up!
You’re a strong communicator who’s able to translate non-technical requests into SQL queries and Looker dashboards and fully explain any insights made to the non-technical stakeholders.
Bonus if you’re familiar with Google Analytics or other analytics platforms (like Mixpanel, Amplitude, Parse.ly), have experience with Salesforce data exploration, have experience with customer data platforms for event tracking (like Segment, mParticle, Heap, etc), and understand data infrastructure.

Why you'll love us

You’ll work at a tech company founded by two badass women—Our founders believe transparency is important so they really try to share as much as they can about changes to The Muse strategy, board meetings, and when they are wrestling with big company-wide decisions.
The Muse actually has—and sticks to—a “no assholes” policy, so you can come to work everyday knowing you will always be surrounded by good people who genuinely care about you.
We invest in growing our people—personally and professionally
We offer unlimited vacation—and we mean it!

At The Muse, we believe that great ideas come from anywhere. We support a collaborative environment and value open participation from individuals with different ideas, experiences, and perspectives. We believe having a diverse team makes The Muse a more interesting and innovative place to work, and we strive every day to make The Muse a welcoming and inclusive place for all.

If this could be your dream job, please submit a cover letter and resume, so we can get to know you a little better.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
3Ci is looking for a BI Developer to join their Partner in Greenville, SC for a full-time, permanent role. This person will be responsible for planning, modeling, developing, and maintaining database elements to support business intelligence and other reporting solutions. Additionally, they’ll be responsible for developing and maintaining business intelligence solutions.
  Key Traits and Skills
Thorough understanding of dimensional data modeling techniques and data warehouse design concepts.
Able to plan, organize, and lead technical aspects of large scale projects to successful conclusion.
Able to provide data modeling and architecture expertise for complex projects.
Able to develop tabular, multidimensional models.
Able to create and analyze SQL queries with T-SQL.
Able to identify and develop corrective processes for data quality issues.
Able to work with users to gather detailed requirements to develop technical specifications.
Able to provide training and assistance on a full range of technical issues to internal/external staff.
Able to provide level of work estimates for technical specifications and other ad-hoc requests.
Able to build or assist in building achievable project plans and timelines.
Able to successfully deliver work/projects to agreed-upon dates.
Able to multi-task and provide timely status updates for all work in progress.
  Previous Experience
Developed BI solutions using Microsoft SQL Server Stack
Proficiency with SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, and Power BI.
Designing, maintaining, and implementing aggregate OLAP data marts and cubes.
Experience developing Tabular models in SQL server 2012-2016 environments.
Data analysis and report and dashboard design/development.
Experience with relational and multi-dimensional database structures, schemas, and architectures.
Experience with SQL Database, Data Factory, and BI solutions using the Microsoft Azure platform.
  Position Requirements
Proven efficiency in developing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions using Microsoft SQL Server SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, and Power BI.
Extensive experience in designing, maintaining, and implementing aggregate OLAP data marts and cubes.
Ability to design and support multi-dimensional models, including the construction of data dimensions, measures, hierarchies, and cubes while using established best practices.
Proficiency in MDX and DAX.
  Expectations:
Conduct design sessions with business users to gather detailed requirements to be translated into technical project plans.
Establish, document, and implement best practices to ensure data quality and efficient solution development.
Design and maintain relational and multi-dimensional data models capable of supporting the reporting needs of the business.
Ensure all new solutions go through peer and user acceptance testing and proper change control processes.
Provide technical expertise to business users and developers in creation of reports, dashboards, and scorecards.
Work within project timelines and budgets.
Assist with evaluation of systems scope and objectives.
Able to evaluate, redesign, and modify existing program logic to improve overall system performance.
Provide input to technical standards and systems investments.
Assist in evaluating alternative protocols, tools, standards and systems investments.
Follow and improve processes for test planning, testing and technical deployment.

As the Data Analyst, Business Intelligence & Analytics, you will help Business, Product, Engineering, and Marketing stakeholders make insightful decisions by identifying relevant data, making it available through empowering reporting, and providing analysis that the stakeholders can use to make their decisions. You will help The Muse “level up” its data usage across the company by working on projects to ensure data quality and data governance. You care about identifying the right data points to answer the right questions with data. You are excited to be part of a team that will be operationalizing work to create a scalable team for the future of the organization.

How you'll make an impact

You’ll work with Product owners to understand product goals, define success metrics, identify tracking needed to answer questions, and build insightful reporting.
You’ll run queries to support ad hoc business questions and create Looker dashboards to enable self-service of other teams.
You’ll be responsible for identifying and helping to resolve data bug issues by providing analysis to communicate the issue and collaborating with Product and Engineering teams to identify and prioritize the fix. You’ll own bugs from the initial identification to the final resolution.
You’ll support company-wide efforts to improve data quality, accessibility, and governance. You’ll help build out systems to make data more open, empowering end users to do their own analysis. You’ll create trainings to teach Musers how to use data for their roles. You’ll work on a framework to create consistent event tracking.
You’ll help evaluate analytics tools and services to best meet the needs of the organization. You’ll help support and maintain these products, implementing changes to improve their functionality.

Why we'll love you

You have 3-5 years of relevant experience in data analysis and are well versed in SQL, Looker, and Excel.
You’re excited to not only provide answers but also to help people learn how to do their own analysis.
You are a “data detective” and will investigate issues until you’ve identified the root cause, ensuring good quality data.
You’re endlessly curious and never willing to ignore an outlier data point.
You want to be part of a team that is creating a BI and Analytics team for the next phase of The Muse that is implementing new services and processes meet stakeholder needs.
You want to provide input to strategic decisions and you bring the data to back your points up!
You’re a strong communicator who’s able to translate non-technical requests into SQL queries and Looker dashboards and fully explain any insights made to the non-technical stakeholders.
Bonus if you’re familiar with Google Analytics or other analytics platforms (like Mixpanel, Amplitude, Parse.ly), have experience with Salesforce data exploration, have experience with customer data platforms for event tracking (like Segment, mParticle, Heap, etc), and understand data infrastructure.

Why you'll love us

You’ll work at a tech company founded by two badass women—Our founders believe transparency is important so they really try to share as much as they can about changes to The Muse strategy, board meetings, and when they are wrestling with big company-wide decisions.
The Muse actually has—and sticks to—a “no assholes” policy, so you can come to work everyday knowing you will always be surrounded by good people who genuinely care about you.
We invest in growing our people—personally and professionally
We offer unlimited vacation—and we mean it!

At The Muse, we believe that great ideas come from anywhere. We support a collaborative environment and value open participation from individuals with different ideas, experiences, and perspectives. We believe having a diverse team makes The Muse a more interesting and innovative place to work, and we strive every day to make The Muse a welcoming and inclusive place for all.

If this could be your dream job, please submit a cover letter and resume, so we can get to know you a little better.

title: Strategic Insights Analyst
description:
The Strategic Insights Analyst reports to the Director of Strategic Marketing and is responsible for market intelligence, voice of customer and commercial operation initiatives to influence business growth and the overall strategic direction of the business according to the ITW business model. The role will interact with multiple functions in the business, primarily with the Sales, Marketing, and Finance organizations to deliver key results. Candidate must be comfortable with data & able generate actionable insights, CRM systems (Salesforce.com, BusinessObjects & Power BI), project management and working in a fast-paced environment.

The position will be based in Greenville SC, the HQ of ITW Hartness.

Primary Responsibilities:
Market Intelligence:
Partner with other stakeholders to perform in-depth Division-wide analysis and assessment of industry, market & competitor trends
Establish and lead an effective global market monitoring process to continuously assess the impact of competitive activities and market dynamics on Division’s strategies; develop recommendations to address challenges
Capture, assess and disseminate intelligence/insights across the organization through quarterly market/competitive updates in support of sales, marketing and product development initiatives
Work with sales teams on key deals to counter competitive claims and position Division in the strongest possible position
Voice of Customer:
Build and cultivate strong relationships across the organization and partners with those responsible for delivering customer touchpoints; advocates for customer needs and pain points to influence positive change
Design end-to-end process to gather, store and analyze voice of customer information across various functions to support business growth.
Identify customer experience opportunities through in-depth analysis of customer journeys, interactions, and business capabilities and take actions to improve customer experience & success
Commercial Operation Support:
Be the champion/administrator of Division CRM (Salesforce.com) and the "go-to" person for the Sales & Marketing team. Drive and operationalize the use of SFDC in the business.
Maintain system metrics to track trends in usage and data integrity; develop KPIs, reports, forecasts, dashboards, and processes to continuously optimize everyday business and lead conversions
Provide ad-hoc support to the commercial organization as needed


Requirements / Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, Engineering or related field
5+ years of related experience
Established analytical skills and proven ability to translate data into actionable insights
Fluent in Microsoft Office suite
Strong experience with Salesforce.com, BusinessObjects, Power BI or related systems
Flexible and adaptable to change in a fast-paced environment
Clear-thinker, good listener, externally focused, problem-solver
Strong oral and written communications skills
Ability to work in and/or lead cross-functional and cross-cultural initiatives
Excellent project management, time management and prioritization skills

title: Business Intelligence Associate
description:
We’re looking for a Business Intelligence Associate who lives and breathes data to join our BizOps team in NYC. If you are motivated by accuracy and business impact with rock star data skills and want to bring value to a socially-conscious, hyper-growth insurance startup, this one’s for you!

Data is at the core of everything that Lemonade does, and we act as the guardians of its integrity, and how it can be best used to make decisions throughout the business. The BizOps team partners with various groups at Lemonade to help the company make business decisions informed by data. We maintain our BI tool, Looker, and work closely with data engineering, product, and others to ensure our data and reporting is reliable, accurate, and supports key decision-making processes.

In this role, you’ll ensure a seamless data experience for core teams throughout the company. We’ll look to you to create analytics and support goal-setting across Lemonade. You’ll create reports and dashboards to monitor KPIs to ensure teams are making intelligent and informed decisions. It will be your responsibility to ensure quality assurance by being proactive in identifying discrepancies and irregularities within dashboards, visuals, and underlying LookML. Lastly, you’ll act as the bridge between technical and non-technical teams across our company, including various global offices, to drive success in data projects.

Requirements
2-4 years of BI experience
Proven SQL mastery (R and Python are plus)
Experience working with different databases and building out data infrastructure and reporting (experience using Looker a plus)
Start-up experience and database knowledge (Snowflake a plus) at a company level
Bachelor's degree in CS, Mathematics, Economics, or similar
Willingness to work with individuals in different time zones and cultures

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
What We're About

We're creating an airline people love. It begins with each Alaska Airlines employee, bringing unique strengths and energy to our work in the air and on the ground. Every day, we go beyond what's expected and reach for the remarkable, together.

YOUR ROLE

Role Summary

Alaska Airlines is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the Operations Research Team. This team supports workgroups by applying advanced analytics on large and diverse datasets to predict operational performance and to craft optimal business strategies over a broad portfolio of initiatives.

As a member of the Operations Research Team, this Analyst works in a fast-paced, high-exposure team whose responsibilities include data analysis, demand modeling and research, optimization, project management, and solution design/delivery. The BI team will translate business intelligence strategy into advanced analytical experiments and models that blend data sources for creative insights into business problems and to align performance with the company's strategic goals, detailed action plans, key performance indicators, and progress metrics. The team also develops and implements systems and technology to produce decision support tools that enable leaders and system practitioners to take strategic action. You must be able to develops visualizations grounded in statistical best practices that facilitate effective communication of results and key findings to internal and external customers.

Scope & Complexity

This individual contributor position supports operations research activities for Alaska Airlines.

Key Duties
In the entry level, under general supervision, you will analyze data and make recommendations for moderately complex business problems and provide input into solutions.
In the intermediate level you will use solid understanding of BI principles to analyze data, make recommendations for approach to problem solving and make recommendations for solutions to complex business problems.
In the senior level, as a subject matter expert in business intelligence, you will apply deep knowledge and use considerable judgement to determine the approach to ambiguous challenges, exercise considerable judgement to make decisions and influence across the company.


Job-Specific Skills, Experience & Education

Entry Level

Required
1 year of analytical experience.
A Bachelor's Degree with a focus in mathematics, economics, operations research, finance, statistics, business, computer science, or technical/engineering, or an additional 2 years of training or experience in lieu of this degree.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of business intelligence functions, including analytics, data mining, reporting, report conversion, data cleansing, data modeling and relational databases.
Experience with relational databases, nested querying, table design, and complex joins.
Experience with applied statistics.
Data-driven mindset and a proven history of continuous self-development.

Intermediate Level

Required
3 years analytical experience.
A Bachelor's degree with a focus in mathematics, economics, operations research, finance, statistics, business, computer science, or technical/engineering, or an additional 2 years of training or experience in lieu of this degree.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of business intelligence functions, including analytics, data mining, reporting, report conversion, data cleansing, data modeling and relational databases.
Advanced SQL skills.
Demonstrated experience working with disparate data sources and data blending.
Adept at dashboard design, charting, and report automation.
Experience with applied statistics and probability.
Ability to work well with multiple, diverse teams.
Data-driven mindset and a proven history of continuous self-development.

Senior Level

Required
4 years of analytical experience.
A Bachelor's degree with a focus in mathematics, economics, finance, statistics, business, computer science, or engineering, or an additional 2 years of training or experience in lieu of this degree.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of business intelligence functions, including to analytics, data mining, reporting, report conversion, data cleansing, data modeling and relational databases.
Advanced SQL skills.
Demonstrated experience working with disparate data sources, data blending, and advanced database functions (e.g., database management functions).
Expert in visualization techniques, dashboard design, and decision support tools; experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Modeling proficiency in cluster analysis and linear regression.
Experience with descriptive and diagnostic statistics, sampling methodology, residuals analysis / ANOVA, and hypothesis / significance testing.
Ability to work well with multiple, diverse teams.
Data-driven mindset and a proven history of continuous self-development.
Demonstrated project management experience.


Required
Must be at least 18 years old
Must be authorized to work in the U.S.
High school diploma or equivalent required

title: Business Operations & Strategy Analyst
description:
Vevo is the world’s largest all-premium music video provider, offering artists a global platform with enormous scale through its distribution partners. Vevo connects artists with their audience globally via music videos and original content, working directly with them to find unique ways to bring their music to life visually. Vevo also works with emerging artists, providing them with a platform of global scale and reach, to find and grow their audience. Reaching 26 billion monthly views globally, Vevo has over 400,000 music videos in its catalogue.

Take a look inside Vevo

The Business Operations and Strategy Analyst is a crucial part of the Business Operations & Strategy team. The role lives at the heart of the company, touches all key business functions, and is focused on growing the promotional and commercial value of our music videos across all distribution platforms. They work cross-functionally with business development, engineering, data science, product, and marketing to design and execute growth and distribution initiatives.

Successful growth and distribution is central to our mission and represents a growing global impact for the business and for Vevo’s artist and label partners. The Business Operations Growth and Development Analyst role will support a variety of initiatives: informing product roadmaps to meet the business needs, evangelizing and running experiments, on-boarding and monitoring distribution partnerships, and ensuring efficient communication of Vevo’s value to our label partners.

As a member of our team you will
Provide analytical support for Vevo’s Product, Engineering and Content teams to develop key insights and suggestions on how to optimize Vevo’s Growth
Collaborate across business functions quickly and work with a diverse set of key Vevo and record label stakeholders.
Partner with Business Development to evaluate new partnership opportunities, prepare analyses in support of negotiations and develop recommendations to present to key stakeholders
Partner with Vevo’s data scientists to design, implement, and evangelize experiments that can extend our understanding of Vevo video performance and inform business strategy.
Build, automate and support actionable dashboards for reporting on Vevo’s content portfolio.
Analyze source traffic patterns in order to reveal non-obvious insights about what drives channel success.
Support daily, weekly and monthly reporting around Vevo’s network and use it to help business partners identify opportunities and translate them into actionable initiatives.
This describes you
You are a strong communicator and can effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to others.
You are a critical thinker: You are thoughtful, self-aware, and use available evidence to make decisions.
You nerd out on data and have a genuine curiosity around using it to find answers and drive strategy.
You enjoy transforming data into compelling visualizations and clearly defined dashboards in business intelligence tools like Looker or Tableau.
You like to see the fruits of your labor translate to growing an organization.
You have experience taking fun seriously; and cheering up your teammates when they need some positive encouragement; you naturally understand that work isn’t work when you love what you do.
Requirements
2+ years of analytical work experience in digital media, marketing, advertising and/or in a business operations and analytics environment.
BA/BS degree with quantitative focus (economics, computer science, mathematics, physics, marketing, digital media, or statistics) or equivalent practical experience.
Strong knowledge of a data analytics toolkit, such as SQL and data warehouse environments (e.g. BigQuery, Redshift, etc.)
Strong communication and influencing skills.
Passion for music and music videos.
Bonus points for experience working with YouTube Analytics and YouTube Creator Studio

We're a fun, energetic, and tight knit team.
We really enjoy music and technology.
We have excellent compensation and benefits packages.
We offer a 401k match.
We have premier access to music content and new releases of original media content.
We are in an upscale New York city office with stunning views of Times Square.

title: Data Analyst, Business Intelligence & Analytics
description:
As the Data Analyst, Business Intelligence & Analytics, you will help Business, Product, Engineering, and Marketing stakeholders make insightful decisions by identifying relevant data, making it available through empowering reporting, and providing analysis that the stakeholders can use to make their decisions. You will help The Muse “level up” its data usage across the company by working on projects to ensure data quality and data governance. You care about identifying the right data points to answer the right questions with data. You are excited to be part of a team that will be operationalizing work to create a scalable team for the future of the organization.

How you'll make an impact

You’ll work with Product owners to understand product goals, define success metrics, identify tracking needed to answer questions, and build insightful reporting.
You’ll run queries to support ad hoc business questions and create Looker dashboards to enable self-service of other teams.
You’ll be responsible for identifying and helping to resolve data bug issues by providing analysis to communicate the issue and collaborating with Product and Engineering teams to identify and prioritize the fix. You’ll own bugs from the initial identification to the final resolution.
You’ll support company-wide efforts to improve data quality, accessibility, and governance. You’ll help build out systems to make data more open, empowering end users to do their own analysis. You’ll create trainings to teach Musers how to use data for their roles. You’ll work on a framework to create consistent event tracking.
You’ll help evaluate analytics tools and services to best meet the needs of the organization. You’ll help support and maintain these products, implementing changes to improve their functionality.

Why we'll love you

You have 3-5 years of relevant experience in data analysis and are well versed in SQL, Looker, and Excel.
You’re excited to not only provide answers but also to help people learn how to do their own analysis.
You are a “data detective” and will investigate issues until you’ve identified the root cause, ensuring good quality data.
You’re endlessly curious and never willing to ignore an outlier data point.
You want to be part of a team that is creating a BI and Analytics team for the next phase of The Muse that is implementing new services and processes meet stakeholder needs.
You want to provide input to strategic decisions and you bring the data to back your points up!
You’re a strong communicator who’s able to translate non-technical requests into SQL queries and Looker dashboards and fully explain any insights made to the non-technical stakeholders.
Bonus if you’re familiar with Google Analytics or other analytics platforms (like Mixpanel, Amplitude, Parse.ly), have experience with Salesforce data exploration, have experience with customer data platforms for event tracking (like Segment, mParticle, Heap, etc), and understand data infrastructure.

Why you'll love us

You’ll work at a tech company founded by two badass women—Our founders believe transparency is important so they really try to share as much as they can about changes to The Muse strategy, board meetings, and when they are wrestling with big company-wide decisions.
The Muse actually has—and sticks to—a “no assholes” policy, so you can come to work everyday knowing you will always be surrounded by good people who genuinely care about you.
We invest in growing our people—personally and professionally
We offer unlimited vacation—and we mean it!

At The Muse, we believe that great ideas come from anywhere. We support a collaborative environment and value open participation from individuals with different ideas, experiences, and perspectives. We believe having a diverse team makes The Muse a more interesting and innovative place to work, and we strive every day to make The Muse a welcoming and inclusive place for all.

If this could be your dream job, please submit a cover letter and resume, so we can get to know you a little better.

Role Summary

Alaska Airlines is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join the Operations Research Team. This team supports workgroups by applying advanced analytics on large and diverse datasets to predict operational performance and to craft optimal business strategies over a broad portfolio of initiatives.

As a member of the Operations Research Team, this Analyst works in a fast-paced, high-exposure team whose responsibilities include data analysis, demand modeling and research, optimization, project management, and solution design/delivery. # Posting Details
## Job Summary
The Director of Business Intelligence will coordinate and manage the activities of a team technical staff, both employees and consultants, in the design, development and delivery of Data Warehouse, OBIEE, and Business Intelligence solutions to produce high-quality and reliable business intelligence output to support strategic University initiatives. This position will partner with a diverse community of stakeholders system-wide to evaluate business needs and ensure these needs have been met successfully by directing the activities of technical staff.
## Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of related experience
5 years of experience managing direct reports
## Preferred Education and Experience
A minimum of ten years of IT enterprise related experience.
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, management information systems, business, or related field. A Master’s Degree is preferred.
Experience with PeopleSoft Enterprise Resource Planning applications.
Familiarity with current architectural directions and industry standards related to development of business intelligence platforms and data warehouse.
Proven ability to supervise, train and motivate staff with emphasis on supervising the work of others including reviewing work and ensuring quality standards.
Ability to demonstrate self-initiative as well as work as a member of a team.
Experience with a higher education institution.
Experience in cloud computing technologies such as AWS.
Experience with data analytics technologies/projects.
Experience with building a data warehouse to support ERP systems.
Experience with Data Governance and supporting data quality initiatives.
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple assignments and priorities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to communicate effectively, both orally and written, with technical and non-technical users, managers, vendors, and consultants.
Experience working in producing quality deliverables and meeting project schedules.
Ability to demonstrate tact and diplomacy, and to maintain a high level of confidentiality.
Ability to demonstrate self-initiative as well as to work well as a team.
Demonstrated sensitivity to diverse user backgrounds and needs.
## Essential Duties and Responsibilities
55% Provides strategic planning, operational planning, implementation oversight, leadership, and management of all activities to support business intelligence, ETL/data modeling, data warehousing, and OBIEE.
5% Implements best practices in business intelligence and expands the capabilities of BI technologies that deliver enterprise-wide reporting, analytics, and data warehousing solutions.
5% Works collaboratively with service offices and administrators throughout the University System to successfully support the use of data for improved decision making.
10% Human Resources & Staffing: Oversee recruiting, hiring, evaluations and disciplinary actions. Ensure staff adhere to established standards for completion of their work. Review staff training plans to ensure that plans align with current technologies and needs. Provide input into performance goals and evaluations to measure and affect the strategic goals of UT SIS.
10% Financial management and planning. Project short- and long-term acquisitions related to development of business intelligence platforms and data warehouse that support industry standards. Work closely with business services to ensure financial stability of technology services. Identify new ways to support financial goals.
5% Reporting, Metrics, and Key Performance Indicators: Develop and report key performance indicators and act upon such information as needed.
5% Vendor Management: Remain accessible to vendors and strengthen key relationships. Support managers and team leads within the organization in addressing vendor-related issues.
5% Other duties as assigned
## Additional Information
Current UTSIS employees will be given priority consideration.

All employees serve as a representative of the University and are expected to display respect, civility, professional courtesy, consideration of others and discretion in all interactions with members of the UT Dallas community and the general public.

Communicate data nuances and insights to all levels of the company in a clear and concise manner

Work closely with business partners in gathering detailed business requirements, establishing business definitions, translating to technical requirements for development team and gaining approval
Interact with senior management or executive level customers and provides support as needed

Maintain metadata dictionaries and report definitions

description:
As the Data Analyst, Business Intelligence & Analytics, you will help Business, Product, Engineering, and Marketing stakeholders make insightful decisions by identifying relevant data, making it available through empowering reporting, and providing analysis that the stakeholders can use to make their decisions. You will help The Muse “level up” its data usage across the company by working on projects to ensure data quality and data governance. You care about identifying the right data points to answer the right questions with data. You are excited to be part of a team that will be operationalizing work to create a scalable team for the future of the organization.

How you'll make an impact

You’ll work with Product owners to understand product goals, define success metrics, identify tracking needed to answer questions, and build insightful reporting.
You’ll run queries to support ad hoc business questions and create Looker dashboards to enable self-service of other teams.
You’ll be responsible for identifying and helping to resolve data bug issues by providing analysis to communicate the issue and collaborating with Product and Engineering teams to identify and prioritize the fix. You’ll own bugs from the initial identification to the final resolution.
You’ll support company-wide efforts to improve data quality, accessibility, and governance. You’ll help build out systems to make data more open, empowering end users to do their own analysis. You’ll create trainings to teach Musers how to use data for their roles. You’ll work on a framework to create consistent event tracking.
You’ll help evaluate analytics tools and services to best meet the needs of the organization. You’ll help support and maintain these products, implementing changes to improve their functionality.

Why we'll love you

You have 3-5 years of relevant experience in data analysis and are well versed in SQL, Looker, and Excel.
You’re excited to not only provide answers but also to help people learn how to do their own analysis.
You are a “data detective” and will investigate issues until you’ve identified the root cause, ensuring good quality data.
You’re endlessly curious and never willing to ignore an outlier data point.
You want to be part of a team that is creating a BI and Analytics team for the next phase of The Muse that is implementing new services and processes meet stakeholder needs.
You want to provide input to strategic decisions and you bring the data to back your points up!
You’re a strong communicator who’s able to translate non-technical requests into SQL queries and Looker dashboards and fully explain any insights made to the non-technical stakeholders.
Bonus if you’re familiar with Google Analytics or other analytics platforms (like Mixpanel, Amplitude, Parse.ly), have experience with Salesforce data exploration, have experience with customer data platforms for event tracking (like Segment, mParticle, Heap, etc), and understand data infrastructure.

Why you'll love us

You’ll work at a tech company founded by two badass women—Our founders believe transparency is important so they really try to share as much as they can about changes to The Muse strategy, board meetings, and when they are wrestling with big company-wide decisions.
The Muse actually has—and sticks to—a “no assholes” policy, so you can come to work everyday knowing you will always be surrounded by good people who genuinely care about you.
We invest in growing our people—personally and professionally
We offer unlimited vacation—and we mean it!

At The Muse, we believe that great ideas come from anywhere. We support a collaborative environment and value open participation from individuals with different ideas, experiences, and perspectives. We believe having a diverse team makes The Muse a more interesting and innovative place to work, and we strive every day to make The Muse a welcoming and inclusive place for all.

If this could be your dream job, please submit a cover letter and resume, so we can get to know you a little better.
